description: From French pommade (“ointment”), from Italian pomata, from pomo (“apple”), as such ointments were originally made from apples, + -ata (“(collective)”) (English -ade). Pomo is in turn from Latin pomum.

entries.meaning: A greasy or waxy substance that is used to style hair, making it look slick and shiny.

verbs.description: pomade (third-person singular simple present pomades, present participle pomading, simple past and past participle pomaded)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To anoint with pomade; to use pomade to style (hair).
examples: He pomaded his hair until it looked like a piece of shiny plastic.
